hook.text: Europe outsourced defense to the US and energy to Russia. Ukraine's war exposed how dangerous that was.

buildup.text: Europe focused on trade and soft power for decades. It assumed the US would handle security and Russia would behave.

discovery.text: Russia's invasion shattered assumptions. Europe rushed to rearm, diversify energy, and rethink its security.

twist.text: European unity is fragile. Hungary blocks sanctions. France and Germany disagree on strategy regularly.

climax.text: If the US pulls back from NATO, Europe must defend itself. It has the money but lacks the will and coordination.

punchline.text: Europe slept through geopolitics. Ukraine was the alarm clock.

quiz.question: How did Russia's invasion of Ukraine affect European security policy?
options: Europe rushed to rearm, diversify energy, and rethink its security strategy
European countries left NATO in response
